I canâ€™t speak for anyone else, but my reasons for being FA is twofold.

1. Iâ€™m ugly. Whatever people say, it isnâ€™t about personality. Itâ€™s about being good looking. Anything else is a bonus. If none wants to look at me, then I canâ€™t progress any further.
2. Iâ€™m too practical. I love facts and figures and thereâ€™s no â€œsoulâ€ behind me. And I realise that can be a turn off. As scientists, it infuriates me to hear women (thought men can be guilty of this) say stuff like â€œIâ€™m such a nerd! I love science! Iâ€™m such a nerd!â€ (While wearing glasses), but when I give them real science (debunking popular tropes, peer reviewed science, etc) I see their eyes glaze over. They donâ€™t actually â€œloveâ€ science, they just like bite sized science facts (of dubious veracity). Just another thing in society weâ€™re trying to simplify.

In conclusion, being FA (Iâ€™m 40) is tough and thereâ€™s many reasons as to why one is FA. But just remember one thing, itâ€™s not all your fault. People are superficial swines....

Youâ€™ve articulated better what Iâ€™ve been trying to say for ages. This is a game we FAers canâ€™t win. Itâ€™s rigged against us. Weâ€™re not good looking. Weâ€™re ugly. Thatâ€™s why life is harder for us. All of our idiosyncrasies and faults can be reasoned away if youâ€™re good looking. Otherwise, weâ€™re just vermin. So, screw them and do what we want to do. If weâ€™re genuinely married to the idea weâ€™re going to die alone, theyâ€™re youâ€™re free! Free to do what you want as the end result will still be the same. Being alone. But at least youâ€™ll have done what you wanted to do. As opposed to sit around waiting for a miracle to happen.

I already have my way of making a dent in the world. Itâ€™ll take some work and thereâ€™s a possibility it may fail, but Iâ€™m going to give it everything I have. I want more FAers to rise up and take their lives by the horns. Itâ€™s YOUR life! Own it! Mould it! Craft it! Turn it into something you want. The world has rejected you. So reject it back.

I honestly have no idea. Iâ€™m not sure I want to be in a relationship where I have to â€œentertainâ€ her. Either sheâ€™s comfortable with me or not. She has to want be with me. In a relationship, all I need is reassurance sheâ€™s happy with me and Iâ€™m a laid back kind of person. But who actually knows? Everyone thinks theyâ€™d be perfect in a relationship, but the truth is somewhat more honest.....

I totally agree, man. Some people are the pigeons and some people are the statue. Try as we might to be normal functioning members of society, others will try their utmost to cut you down in the name of making themselves feel better.....and thereâ€™s nothing we can do about it. Itâ€™s all our fault. Weâ€™re creeps, weâ€™re anti social, weâ€™re weirdos (pick your pejorative). Apparently, itâ€™s all of our own doing. Unless youâ€™re a female, then suddenly, youâ€™ll get all the sympathy in the world. 

Now, Iâ€™m not saying females donâ€™t have their own crosses to bear and anyone who says otherwise is living in cloud cuckoo land. But how come weâ€™re totally responsible for others harassing us? When was this an acceptable form of victim blaming? And does any of this make you more attractive to the gender you find attractive? Hell no! 

For the record, some people donâ€™t help themselves! But they still can live their life how they see fit. But the truth is weâ€™re ugly. I hate to break it to you but if youâ€™re treated like this, youâ€™re ugly. Which makes all your traits and idiosyncrasies ugly. If you were good looking? Then suddenly all your traits and idiosyncrasies become â€œquirksâ€ and â€œfoiblesâ€. Theyâ€™re now socially acceptable and, dare I say it? A bit cute! Itâ€™s all rubbish. 

Just do you. Save money, take pride in your job, keep a tidy home, try to exercise more. Be the best you can be. And donâ€™t do it to get people off your back. Do it to make yourself feel better. As awful as people picking on us is, we do need to do our part for our own good.

(Source: I was an ugly, overweight, out of shape cretin who coasted at their job. Now Iâ€™m financially secure, slimmer, fitter and excelling at my job. But Iâ€™m still ugly and a cretin. But one step at a time, eh...?)

I feel like that. And the reason is without a partner, a lot of the flavour of life has been taken out. Without a partner, a lot of social activities come off your menu. So whatâ€™s left? Work, sleep and eating. Basic functions of humanity. Weâ€™re just existing, not living. The only joy I get from just working is all the money and wealth I save.
